titleStmt.title: Five Catholick letters concerning the means of knowing with absolute certainty what faith now held was taught by Jesus Christ written by J. Sergeant upon occasion of a conference between Dr. Stillingfleet and Mr. Peter Gooden.
titleStmt.author: Sergeant, John, 1622-1707.

titleStmt.title: Five Catholick letters concerning the means of knowing with absolute certainty what faith now held was taught by Jesus Christ written by J. Sergeant upon occasion of a conference between Dr. Stillingfleet and Mr. Peter Gooden.
titleStmt.author: Sergeant, John, 1622-1707.
Stillingfleet, Edward, 1635-1699.
Gooden, Peter, d. 1695.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by Mat. Turner,

notesStmt.note: Title page lacking. Facsimile t.p. used as chief source of information.

5 pts. Each part has also separate t.p. pt. 1. A letter to the D. of P. in answer to the arguing part of his first letter to Mr. G. London : Printed by Henry Hills, 1687--pt. 2. The second Catholick letter ... London : Printed and sold by Matthew Turner, 1687--pt. 3. The third Catholick letter ... / by S.J. London : Printed and sold by Matthew Turner, 1687--pt. 4. The fourth Catholick letter ... / by John Sergeant. London : Printed and sold by Matthew Turner, 1688--pt. 5. The fifth Catholick letter ... / by John Sergeant. London : Printed and sold by Matthew Turner.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
